channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Officials from U.S., Europe meet in London for Ukraine peace talks
item.description: The U.S. is showing signs that it is increasingly willing to withdraw from a peace process that has grown more complex in recent months.

item.title: Environmental groups say Trump administration violated their free-speech rights
item.description: A lawsuit alleges the Trump administration violated the free-speech rights of nonprofits and municipalities that have had federal funding for climate ...

item.title: IMF warns of economic impacts of Trump's tariffs. And, Pope Francis lies in state
item.description: The International Monetary Fund is warning that President Trump's tariffs could pose significant challenges for the global economy. And, Pope Francis'...

item.title: What to know as the government begins collections on defaulted student debt
item.description: The Department of Education says it will resume collections on May 5 and send wage garnishment notices "later this summer." Here's how to know — and w...

item.title: Word of the Week: The papal 'conclave' is secretive. The word's origin explains why
item.description: The word itself predates Christianity, but the conclave with its secretive deliberations and ancient trappings still captures the public's curiosity.

item.title: Suspension of Ghana's chief justice is 'abuse of power', says opposition
item.description: This is the first time in Ghana's history that a president has removed a chief justice from office.

item.title: Orders to leave the country — some for US citizen — sow confusion among immigrants
Mar 19: CBS News 24/7, 1pm ET
item.description: President Trump says phone call with Zelenskyy was "very good"; Scammers take over Google Maps.

item.title: Abbas calls Hamas 'sons of dogs' and demands release of Gaza hostages
item.description: Palestinian Authority president says that Hamas has given Israel "excuses" to continue the Gaza war.

item.title: U.S. citizen DHS held 10 days has intellectual disabilities, family says
item.description: Jose Hermosillo, a U.S. citizen who was detained by DHS for 10 days and prosecuted for illegal entry into the U.S. has intellectual disabilities, his ...

item.title: Mar 19: CBS News 24/7, 4pm ET
item.description: Trump speaks with Zelenskyy to discuss reaching ceasefire with Russia; Family of missing spring breaker believes she drowned

item.title: US intensifying bid to end Ukraine war - but chances of success remain unclear
item.description: Negotiations are gathering pace but the proposals being put forward by Trump's team still have major gaps

item.title: Nine killed in Russian attack on Ukraine bus
item.description: At least 30 were injured in the city of Marhanets in central-south Ukraine.

item.title: Watch Live: N.J. wildfire prompts state of emergency in Ocean County
item.description: The Jones Road Wildfire in Ocean County, N.J. triggered a state of emergency after mandatory evacuations overnight in Ocean and Lacey townships.

item.title: Vance says US will 'walk away' unless Ukraine and Russia agree to proposals
item.description: Vance issued the warning after top US officials pulled out of London talks aimed at securing a ceasefire.

item.title: Dow soars more than 1,000 points amid relief rally
item.description: The stock market was off to a strong start Wednesday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average soaring over 1,000 points.

item.title: Immigrants in the US unlawfully can drive legally in 19 states. Now some states want to stop them
FAA finds safety concerns at Las Vegas airport in review spurred by midair collision in Washington
item.description: A federal review of helicopter safety around some of the busiest U.S. airports has revealed dangerous flying conditions at the Las Vegas airport.
